title.narrative: BI - Agro-Pastoral Productivity and Markets Development Project

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to increase small producers' productivity and market access for Targeted Commodities in the Project Area.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Finance and Planning for Economic Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, D.2 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not laterthan 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter, a report on the implementation of the Safeguard Instruments | Frequency:SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, E.1 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association, not laterthan November 30 of each year, an annual work plan of activities | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, A.4 | Description :Mid-term review of the project, 36 months after the Effective Date,or such other date as may be agreed upon by the Recipient and the Association. | Due Date :15-Feb-2014
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, B.1 | Description :Maintain a financial management system, not later than 3 months afterEffective Date. | Due Date :31-Mar-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, B.2 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not laterthan 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim unaudited financial reports for the Project covering the quarter | DueDate :31-Jan-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, B.4 | Description :Recruitment of auditors not later than 3 months after the EffectiveDate | Due Date :31-Mar-2011

title.narrative: Participating producer groups / associations/ cooperatives having contractual arrangements with marketing agents
Productivity increases in selected value chains supported by the AF
Increased volume of processed produce marketed (disaggregated by commodity - average
Number of nurseries created for bananas and fruit trees
Number of farmer group leaders trained in group dynamics/management and business development issues
Increased adoption of climate-resilient technologies (% number of beneficiaries)
Targeted beneficiaries are satisfied with project intervention (disaggregated by type of intervention).
Production of commodity in targeted value chains marketed by participating producers
Producers adopting animal breeds and husbandry practices for milk production
Participating farmers (male/female) adopting new technology packages (for production, post-harvest, processing, etc.)
